TrainingElement.Title: Component
TrainingElement.BodyCopy:
The Component element is where users identify components that are to be used within a web page.

Components

   Components are predefined web content that can be inserted into web pages. Components are not web pages themselves, but do stand independent form web pages as selectable items within the CMS tree.

   Components can be shared by multiple web pages at anyone time, and any changes made to a component will show in all the web pages using the component.

   When making components it is best to store components within a folder.

Using the Correct Component

   Not all components are the same, and each component element will only work with certain component types. When choosing a component with a given component element, the component element will find and show only components it can use. Thus the banner ad component element will only show banner ad components in the "Select a Component" window.

Interface

Pick

   The Pick button allows the user to choose a component to activate. The "Select a Component" window will display listing all possible components.

   To narrow your search you can type the name of the component you wish to use in the top right corner text field.

Go To

   The Go To button takes you to the component currently active in the component field.

Clear

   The Clear button removes the active component.

FAQ

Q. I want to use a specific component, but it doesn't show within the "Select a Component" window. Why?

       A. Does the component you have created match the component element you are using?      See section "Using the Correct Component".
